body_html:
@peterjc123 , In order to pursue tidiness, I did what follows:

  1. I created a new env with python 3.6, which I named superfasty.
  2. I did conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch cuda80
  3. I installed no other packages, in order not to pollute that fresh env.

Installed cuda80 version just because I have cuda 8.0 in the CUDA_PATH env var, and tensorflow works with it.

Now, coming to your instructions:

**As you may see, C:\Users\poko\Anaconda2\envs\superfasty\Library does exists in PATH **.

I added a conda list just to report what packages are installed into that env:

It still doesn't work, however:

On the verge of desperation, I directly called the python interpreter inside my env, with no luck:

Finally, let me add a newly taken dep walker dump, just for the sake of completeness
_C.cp36-win_amd64.txt

Thanks a lot!

I created a new env with python 3.6, which I named superfasty.
I did conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch cuda80
I installed no other packages, in order not to pollute that fresh env.

Installed cuda80 version just because I have cuda 8.0 in the CUDA_PATH env var, and tensorflow works with it.

Now, coming to your instructions:

**As you may see, C:\Users\poko\Anaconda2\envs\superfasty\Library does exists in PATH **.
I added a conda list just to report what packages are installed into that env:

It still doesn't work, however:

On the verge of desperation, I directly called the python interpreter inside my env, with no luck:

Finally, let me add a newly taken dep walker dump, just for the sake of completeness
_C.cp36-win_amd64.txt
Thanks a lot!
body:
@peterjc123 , In order to pursue tidiness, I did what follows:

1. I created a new env with python 3.6, which I named `superfasty`.
2. I did `conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch cuda80`
3. I installed no other packages, in order not to pollute that fresh env.

Installed cuda80 version just because I have cuda 8.0 in the `CUDA_PATH` env var, and tensorflow works with it.

![capture3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35294634/34776177-2fc89a86-f616-11e7-856e-7a417ef0a7a6.PNG)

## Now, coming to your instructions:

![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35294634/34775053-1b66a320-f612-11e7-8ada-5f63209bf0e1.PNG)

**As you may see, `C:\Users\poko\Anaconda2\envs\superfasty\Library` does exists in `PATH` **.

I added a `conda list` just to report what packages are installed into that env:

![capture2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35294634/34775066-21a2b6fc-f612-11e7-8a65-37be7ee16e59.PNG)

### It still doesn't work, however:

![capture3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35294634/34775270-db66fbca-f612-11e7-87c8-853dc4c688de.PNG)

On the verge of desperation, I directly called the python interpreter inside my env, with no luck:

![capture3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35294634/34775790-b067829e-f614-11e7-9ff8-4d7026fb0e23.PNG)

Finally, let me add a newly taken dep walker dump, just for the sake of completeness
[_C.cp36-win_amd64.txt](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/files/1618944/_C.cp36-win_amd64.txt)

Thanks a lot!
